letters.description: Establish a safe, non-judgmental space built on trust and collaboration.
Actively listen to understand the client's experiences, concerns, and desires.
Explore sexual values, beliefs, and knowledge; provide relevant education.
Assess sexual functioning, identify potential challenges, and increase self-awareness.
Develop personalized strategies and techniques to enhance sexual well-being.
Identify and address underlying emotional, psychological, or relational blocks.
Integrate new insights and skills; regularly re-evaluate progress and adjust strategies.
Foster self-acceptance, confidence, and embodied pleasure for lasting sexual fulfillment.
